title: Maitri II Research Station in Antarctica
summary: India's upcoming fourth research station, Maitri II, is slated for completion by January 2029. This new station will replace the existing Maitri station, which has been operational since 1989. Maitri II will be a 'green research base', emphasizing renewable energy. Studying Antarctica's ice sheets is critical for understanding and forecasting global sea-level rise.
